deduplication.__main__

Attributes

parser

Parses command-line arguments for creating a corpus.

Module Contents

deduplication.__main__.parser

Parses command-line arguments for creating a corpus.

This script defines various command-line arguments for processing input files, defining parameters, and choosing methods for the assignment’s corpus creation.

Parameters:

  • -d (str) – Required. Directory path of the input file.

  • --indir (str) – Required. Directory path of the input file.

  • -t (str) – Required. Type of use case.

  • --case (str) – Required. Type of use case.

  • -s (str) – Optional. Whether to output results to a text file (‘y’ or ‘n’).

  • --save (str) – Optional. Whether to output results to a text file (‘y’ or ‘n’).

  • -e (str) – Optional. Document to query.

  • --example (str) – Optional. Document to query.

  • -n (int) – Optional. Number of hash functions to use.

  • --numhash (int) – Optional. Number of hash functions to use.

  • -b (int) – Optional. Number of bands.

  • --numband (int) – Optional. Number of bands.

  • -r (int) – Optional. Number of rows per band.

  • --row (int) – Optional. Number of rows per band.

  • -k (int) – Optional. Length of shingles.

  • --shinlen (int) – Optional. Length of shingles.

  • -c (int) – Optional. Size of the tree.

  • --treesize (int) – Optional. Size of the tree.

  • -m (str) – Optional. Default is ‘LSH’. Specifies the method to use. Options: ‘baseline’, ‘LSH’, ‘LSH_mp’, ‘LSH_forest’.

  • --method (str) – Optional. Default is ‘LSH’. Specifies the method to use. Options: ‘baseline’, ‘LSH’, ‘LSH_mp’, ‘LSH_forest’.

Returns:

An object containing the parsed arguments.

Return type:

Namespace
